recipe_name: Turkey osso bucco with salsa verde
author: Brian Turner
method: Preheat the oven to 170C/340F/Gas 3½. Heat the olive oil in an ovenproof casserole. Put the flour in a bowl, season with salt and pepper. Coat the thighs with flour and shake off the excess. Fry in the casserole skin-side down first, and then turn to colour all over. Remove the meat from the pan and set aside. Put the onion, carrot and celery into the casserole dish and fry until golden-brown, then add the garlic, thyme and bay leaves. Add the tomatoes and sugar to the casserole and put the thighs on top of vegetables in a single layer. Cover with stock and white wine and bring to the boil. Cover with a circle of greaseproof paper and a lid. Cook in the oven for about two hours, or until well cooked. Carefully lift the turkey from the casserole and set aside somewhere warm. To thicken the sauce (if necessary) bring the cooking liquor to a boil and cook until the volume of liquid has reduced .  For the salsa verde, place all the ingredients in a bowl and mix together. Mix the orange zest and parsley. To serve, put a thigh in each serving dish and pour over the sauce. Sprinkle with the zest and parsley and serve with the salsa verde.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp flour,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  4 turkey thighs, skin on,  1 onion, chopped,  2 carrots, chopped,  2 celery sticks, chopped,  2 garlic cloves, crushed,  2 sprigs thyme, tied together,  2 bay leaves,  6 tomatoes, cut into quarters,  1 tsp sugar,  300ml/½ pint chicken stock,  125ml/4fl oz dry white wine,  1 orange, zest only, grated,  1 tbsp chopped parsley,  big bunch parsley,  2 tbsp baby capers,  2 tbsp chopped cornichons,  12 anchovy fillets,  3 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped,  3 tbsp red wine vinegar,  1 tbsp olive oil,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
